contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses}} {{See also|Quan|Kwan (surname)|}} '''Guan''' may refer to any of three [[Chinese family name]]s (both rendered in [[Standard Cantonese|Cantonese]] as [[Kwan (surname)|Kwan]], or also in [[English language|English]] as [[Kuan (disambiguation)|Kuan]], [[Kwan (surname)|Kwan]], [[Quan]], or [[Quon]]). The three names are as follows: ==Guan (管)== {{See also|Guan (state)}} '''Guan''' ({{zh|c=[[wiktionary:管|管]]|p=guǎn| w=kuan3|l=pipe/tube/duct; a woodwind instrument; to manage/control}}), The corresponding [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]] version is '''Quản''', and the anglicized variation is '''Quan'''. origin from {{Wiktionary|管}} *[[Guan Shu]] (管叔) the ruler of the [[Guan (state)|State of Guan]] and uncle of [[King Wu of Zhou]] *[[King Mu of Zhou]] of the [[Zhou Dynasty]] *[[Guwalgiya]] (瓜尔佳) family the [[Jurchen people]] of [[Jin Dynasty (1115–1234)|Jin Dynasty]] *[[Xibe people]] in [[Manchuria]] at [[Qing Dynasty]] ===People with the surname Guan 管=== *[[Guan Zhong]] (管仲, ? – 645 BCE) of the [[Qi (state)|State of Qi]] *[[Guan Pinghu]] (管平湖, 1897–1967), Chinese [[guqin]] musician *[[Guan Moye]] (管謨業, 1955), Mo Yan (莫言), Chinese Writer ==Guan (官)== Guan ([[wiktionary:官|官]]) is a [[Chinese language|Chinese]] family name, Guan, [[Kuan (disambiguation)|Kuan]], [[Quan]], [[Gwan]], [[Kwan (surname)|Kwan]] in common, origin from; *Guan (官) the [[Region]] name of [[Shanxi Province]] in [[Jin (Chinese state)|Jin (state)]] (晉) *Guan People (官) in [[Ancient]] Chinese [[Minority Group]] in around of [[Shanxi Province]] *[[Shangguan]] (上官) family of [[Chu (state)]] (楚) *Guan (關) family the [[Kwan (surname)|Kwan]] family *[[Mulao people|Mulao]] (仫佬) people of [[Jin Dynasty (1115–1234)|Jin Dynasty]] (金) period *[[Manchu people]], [[Mongols|Mongolian]], etc. ==Guan (關) : Kwan== {{see also|Kwan (surname)}} {{Wiktionary|關}} '''Guan''' ({{zh|c=[[wiktionary:關|關]]/关|p=guān| w=kuan1|l=shut; close; barrier}}) is pronounced and transliterated in a variety of ways. In [[Standard Mandarin|Mandarin Chinese]] it is [[Hanyu Pinyin]]: '''Guan''' [[Wade-Giles]]: '''Kuan'''. In [[Yue Chinese|Cantonese]] it is '''Kwan'''. The corresponding [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]] version is '''Quan'''. Mandarin Wade-Giles is [[Han]], [[Xian]], Guan. see [[Kwan (surname)]] [[Category:Chinese-language surnames]]
